input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
Specifies the server type. Type must be an integer. For example, /type=4 displays all file servers. If you do not specify /type, ipxroute servers displays all types

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation success? Valid values: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported."</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported."</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">ipxroute server</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${type }')!=0"> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="number('${type }')"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> type=${type }</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise /> </xsl:choose> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Displays the Service Access Point (SAP) table for the specified server type. X must be an integer. For example, /type=4 displays all file servers. If you do not specify /type, ipxroute servers displays all types of servers, listing them by server name.
